Defining custom events and receivers
Registering broadcast receiver for custom events
You can register a receiver for your custom actions.
The following AndroidManifest.xml file demonstrates a broadcast receiver which is registered for a custom action.
Sending broadcast intents
The `sendBroadcast()` method from the `Context` class allows you to send intents to your registered receivers. The following coding show an example.
You cannot trigger system broadcasts events. The Android system will prevent this.
The receivers are called asynchronous, i.e., the `sendBroadcast()` method return immediately and does not wait until the receivers have executed.
Local broadcast events with LocalBroadcastManager
The `LocalBroadcastManager` class is used to register for and send broadcasts of Intents to local objects within your process. This is faster and more secure as your events don't leave your application.
